info.description:
Scheduling Setup allows you to access and configure Scheduling entities.

Refer to the [Scheduling overview](doc:scheduling-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
info.title: Scheduling Setup

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve and manipulate team absence quota overrides.
tags.name: Absence Quota Overrides

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve information about Calendar profiles.
tags.name: Calendar Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete certifications. Certifications are employee attributes that work alongside skills to allow the system to assign the most qualified person to do a job.
tags.name: Certifications Setup

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve coverage counting profiles. Coverage counts configure the calculations that compare coverage against workload, and assign those settings to a location. Coverage views can show fractional workloads, coverage in periods shorter than zones, and coverage by job group. Organizational locations inherit coverage count settings.
tags.name: Coverage Counting Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve day type equivalencies. Day type equivalence values adjust accrual balances according to the day type of absences: one absence day equals n accrual days.
tags.name: Day Type Equivalencies

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update, and delete Employee Self Service (ESS) Calendar Settings.
tags.name: ESS Calendar Settings

tags.description:
This resource allows managers to retrieve employee visibility periods and filter by ID, name, or search criteria.

An employee visibility period defines the:

  • Submission Period -- The time period when an employee can submit a request for schedule changes.
  • Request Period -- The date range when the request can occur. Example: If the request period is July 1-August 31, the employee can submit requests only for times during July and August.
  • Group Type -- The Hyperfind query of employees who can submit requests.
  • Recurring Period -- Repeats the schedule every X days, weeks, or months.
  • Rolling Period -- Moves the entire schedule forward by a day at a time. The employee can request a schedule change after x number of days from that day (to give lead time to the manager) for a specific time period or for an unlimited time. For example, if the date today is May 15th, the employee can request time off, after a 5 day delay, on May 20th for 30 days.
  • Schedule and Open Shift Visibility -- Employees can see the unposted schedule during the submission period and available open shifts.
tags.name: Employee Visibility Periods

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve holiday and unscheduled day request settings, which configure paycodes for requests that involve unscheduled days and that overlap holidays.
tags.name: Holiday and Unscheduled Day Request Settings

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve indicators for schedule metrics.
tags.name: Indicators

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve location profile option sets, which contain metrics, procedures, and holiday information and are used by the Priority Scheduling Engine (PSE), Call List, and Sort Employees feature. Location profile option sets are inherited in the organizational map.
tags.name: Location Profiles Option Sets

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve Minor Rule Sets. Minor rules are legally binding scheduling rules and penalties that regulate minor employees, who are typically aged 14 to 18. The age range may vary by jurisdiction.

Scheduler and the Auto-Scheduler can schedule minor employees according to labor laws in their jurisdiction. Different minor rule sets can be configured for each jurisdiction.
tags.name: Minor Rule Sets

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to retrieve and manipulate occurrence definitions.

An occurrence definition defines the minimum or maximum limit of events of a certain length in an employee's schedule.
tags.name: Occurrence Definitions

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate partial shift settings.
tags.name: Partial Shift Settings

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve pattern template profiles.
tags.name: Pattern Template Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update, and delete paycode value profiles, which help determine the applicable paycode values for a person.
tags.name: Paycode Value Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to retrieve and manipulate schedule period definitions.

Schedule periods define the time period that Scheduler loads when you select previous, current, or next schedule period. The schedule period can be up to one year, and it can differ from the pay period.
tags.name: Period Definitions

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate predictive Scheduling elements. Using this resource, you can determine if a Predictive Rule has been violated and generate a Predictive Tag in the schedule.
tags.name: Predictive Scheduling

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and update predictive scheduling bonuses, which allow to define which type of bonuses employees will have.
tags.name: Predictive Scheduling Bonus

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, and update predictive scheduling rules, which combine predictive scheduling bonus and schedule change criteria.
tags.name: Predictive Scheduling Rules

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to retrieve procedure sets as a filtered list or singly by ID or name. A procedure set is a sequence of instructions that completes a scheduling task, such as sorting employees, matching employees to open shifts, and assigning employees with the best match.

  • Procedure sets for the PSE can contain one step, or be complex and contain several steps.
  • Procedure sets for the Call List and Sort Employees have one step.

Typically, a procedure set contains:

  • Procedures: A procedure is a step that groups priority rule sets.
  • Rule sets: A priority rule set groups related sorting and matching rules in order. A step can contain any number or type of rule sets, in any order, or no rule sets at all.
tags.name: Procedure Sets

tags.description: This resource allows you to to create, retrieve, update, and delete proficiency levels, which define an employee's level of proficiency in a skill or certification.
tags.name: Proficiency Levels

tags.description:
This resource allows you to define when an employee is allowed to submit a specific type of time-off request and the period during which the time off may be taken.

For example, in a certain department, the period when summer vacation may be taken runs from June 1 to August 31. Employees are required to request their summer vacation time off no earlier than January 1 and no later than April 30.
tags.name: Request Submission Periods

tags.description: This resource allows managers to retrieve request subtypes and filter by ID, name, or search criteria.
tags.name: Request Subtypes

tags.description: This resource provides a set of operations that allow you to access and update schedule builder configurations.
tags.name: Schedule Builder Settings

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate schedule change criteria, which define the criteria used to create predictive tags.
tags.name: Schedule Change Criteria

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Schedule Event Rules. These rules can be assigned to an Employee Rule Set.
tags.name: Schedule Event Rules

tags.description: This resource allows a System Administrator to retrieve and manipulate schedule events.
tags.name: Schedule Events

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve schedule groups.

Schedule groups organize employees who share characteristics such as schedules into groups that make their schedules easier to manage. When you create schedule groups, you can assign schedules and schedule entities to all members of the group.
tags.name: Schedule Groups

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update, and delete Schedule Patterns.

Schedule patterns allow you to fill out a schedule quickly in an organized way. Once you have defined and saved a pattern as a Schedule template, you can assign it to any employee or group of employees.

Pattern Templates also make it possible to modify the schedule of a number of employees simultaneously by modifying the pattern assigned to them.
tags.name: Schedule Patterns

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all schedule periods, or to retrieve specific schedule periods by ID or qualifier. Schedule periods define the time period that Scheduler loads when you retrieve the previous, current, or next schedule period. The schedule period can be up to one year, and it can differ from the pay period.
tags.name: Schedule Periods

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and update rule set assignments associated with a location. Schedule rule sets contain the restrictions and requirements of a schedule and include employee and organizational rules.
tags.name: Schedule Rule Set Location Assignments

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve Schedule rule sets, which contain the restrictions and requirements of a schedule and include employee and organizational rules.
tags.name: Schedule Rule Sets

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve all Schedule rules, or to retrieve specific Schedule rules by name, ID, or object reference.
tags.name: Schedule Rules

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate schedule score definitions.
tags.name: Schedule Score Definitions

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate schedule score factors.
tags.name: Schedule Score Factors

tags.description:
This resource allows a System Administrator to retrieve schedule zone sets and any assignments associated with those sets.

A schedule zone is a span of time during a 24-hour period that measures coverage. Examples include Day, Evening, or Night zones.

A schedule zone set collects non-overlapping schedule zones for all or part of a day. To use schedule zones in the Workload Planner, group them into schedule zone sets.

In an organization that uses many shifts of differing lengths, use schedule zones to determine coverage by time spans during the day.
tags.name: Schedule Zone Sets

tags.description:
Scheduling Setup allows you to access and configure Scheduling entities.

Refer to the [Scheduling overview](doc:scheduling-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
tags.name: Scheduling Setup

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve school calendar profiles.
tags.name: School Calendar Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve school calendars, which define a minor employee's school schedule and work in conjunction with Minor Rules to meet a jurisdiction's rules and regulations concerning the employment of minors.
tags.name: School Calendars

tags.description:
This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete shift template profiles.

Shift templates define a standard shift with common characteristics for one or many employees. You can then assign the shift to an employee or to many employees without needing to specify any characteristics.

A Service Limit applies to some of the bulk operations against this resource. Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.
tags.name: Shift Template Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, update, and delete shift templates.

A shift template is a shift that has a name and defined segments and attributes, but no date or assigned employee.

Use shift templates when any of the following apply:

  • The organization uses standard shifts to assign to employees.
  • Multiple employees work the same shift.
  • Employees use Employee Self-Service (ESS) for scheduling to create and manage their own schedules.
tags.name: Shift Templates

tags.description: This resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete skills. Skills are employee attributes that work alongside certifications to allow the system to assign the most qualified person to do a job.
tags.name: Skills Setup

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate Staffing Dashboard Settings.
tags.name: Staffing Dashboard Settings

tags.description:
This resource allows a System Administrator to retrieve staffing matrices, which map volume to staffing requirements for each job or location.

For example, if the volume is 0 to 5, assign 1 worker to the job. If the volume is 5 to 10, assign 2 workers to the job.

Volume is the value that drives a staffing matrix. Volumes can be weighted to transform the volume. With a weighted volume, the Workload Generator can use a different volume value to generate workload.
tags.name: Staffing Matrices

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate staffing profiles. After you define a Staffing Dashboard, you can assign it to a staffing profile, which is then assigned to a Display Profile.
tags.name: Staffing Profiles

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve standard shift set assignments.

A workload shift set contains a collection of shifts that define workload (staffing) requirements for locations. Create shift sets to display coverage by shifts.
tags.name: Standard Shift Set Assignments

tags.description:
This resource allows you to retrieve standard shift sets.

A workload shift set contains a collection of shifts that define workload (staffing) requirements for locations. Create shift sets to display coverage by shifts.
tags.name: Standard Shift Sets

tags.description:
This resource provides a set of operations that allows you to manipulate Scheduling swap recommendation settings.

When employees request to swap shifts, recommendations show employees a list of shifts in order from the best matches. The best matches have a rating of the closeness of the match and a message that describes the reason for the recommendation.

To generate recommendations, the system considers the following:

  • The employee's history of shift swaps:
    • Often swap with specific employees
    • Often work a specific day
    • Often work a specific combination of days
    • Often work a specific job
    • Often work at a specific location
  • The employee's explicit preferences:
    • Match a preferred job
    • Match a preferred availability
    • Match a preferred work zone
    • Willingness to work more hours
  • The employee's inferred preferences:
    • Similarity to the shift that is offered
    • Similarity to a shift that the employee usually works
    • Shift duration
    • Shift time
    • Shift job or location
    • Match to skills & certification
    • Work with a person that the employee often works with
    • Work with friends
tags.name: Swap Recommendations Settings Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve symbolic source types. Instead of entering a specific amount for a paycode, a symbolic amount lets users enter a value such as full, which translates to the number of hours in an employee's shift. Other default symbolic amounts include half, 1st half, and 2nd half.
tags.name: Symbolic Source Types

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, and update tag definitions.
tags.name: Tag Definitions

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to create, retrieve, and update team definitions.

Define teams to optimize guided recommendations for your organization so that managers can balance time-off requests with coverage needs and accruals balances.
tags.name: Team Definitions

tags.description:
This resource allows users to retrieve and manipulate visibility period actions.

Visibility periods dictate when and for which periods employees can submit certain types of requests. A lot of flexibility is offered to organizations around defining these visibility periods which ultimately result in different ways of sequencing when employees can submit their requests. In a simple scenario, it may be that all employees can requests time off for the same date ranges at the same time whereas in more complex use cases, organizations may want to split employees by group and possibly even sequence employees within each group by seniority.
tags.name: Visibility Period Actions

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve worker types.
tags.name: Worker Types

tags.description: This resource allows you to perform bulk create, update, read, and delete operations on workload patterns.
tags.name: Workload Patterns

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve information about Workload Planner Profiles. Workload Planner Profiles contain the names of the Workload Planners that are available to managers. Multiple Workload Planners can give quick access to multiple staffing plans. For example, you can configure a separate staffing plan for each time period and associate Workload Planners with an organizational location.
tags.name: Workload Planner Profiles

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve zone categories, which are associated with employee preferences and, if an employee works in a location that uses a workload plan by schedule zones, defines his or her preferred zone category and preferred zone.
tags.name: Zone Categories

get.description:
This operation returns all minor rules if no parameter is specified or a particular minor rule if a name is provided.

This operation returns the following response model when the `all_details` query parameter is false:

```
{
  "active": true,
  "description": "DESCRIPTION",
  "id": 1,
  "name": "NAME"
}

```

parameters.description: The name of a minor rule.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not to include inactive records as a collection in the response body.
parameters.name: include_inactive

parameters.description: A Boolean indicator of whether or not the response returns all details of each minor rule. When false, the response returns only the ID, name, active and description of each minor rule.
parameters.name: all_details

get.summary: Retrieve All Minor Rules or by Name

```
    "name": "NAME"
  }
]

```

207.description: Partially retrieved a collection of minor rules.

get.description: This operation returns a single procedure set by name.
get.operationId: Retrieve Procedure Set by Name

parameters.description: The name of the procedure set to retrieve.
parameters.name: name

get.summary: Retrieve Procedure Set by Name

post.description:
This operation returns a list of procedure sets filtered by object reference or procedure type.

When constructing the JSON body of your request, keep the following points in mind:

  • Use the where.procedureSets array to filter the list of returned procedure sets by directly referencing the procedure set objects using IDs or names.
    • The qualifier property is used to pass names.
  • Use the where.procedureType array to filter the list of returned procedure sets by procedure type using an ID or name.
    • The qualifier property is used to pass the name of the procedure type.

requestBody.description: Request data containing either a collection of references to procedure sets or a reference to a procedure type.

ids.description: An array of schedule group IDs. Schedule groups are retrieved for valid identifiers specified in this array.

persistentIds.description: An array of schedule group persistent IDs. Schedule groups are retrieved for valid persistent IDs specified in this array.

qualifiers.description: An array of schedule group names. Schedule groups are retrieved for valid names specified in this array.

refs.description: An array of references to schedule group objects. Schedule groups are retrieved for valid IDs or names specified in this array of object references.

ids.description: A list of staffing profile IDs.

qualifiers.description: A list of staffing profile qualifiers.

refs.description: A list of references to staffing profile objects.

SchedulingAbsenceQuota.description: The model that contains the information about the absence quota of a team definition.

dayOfWeek.description: The day of the week the quota is applied to.

percent.description: The percentage associated with an absence quota.

SchedulingRecommendedThreshold.description: Value used in formula to determine status of guided recommendation.

yellowDaysLimit.description: The yellow days limit of an absence quota.

SchedulingFindTeamDefinitionsWhereEmploy.description: Parameters used to find by employee references and date span.

endDate.description: The inclusive end date to search for team definitions within a date span.

startDate.description: The inclusive start date to search for team definitions within a date span.

SchedulingFindTeamDefinitionsWhereTeamDe.description: Parameters used to find by team definition references.

RequestSubmissionPeriodAction.description: Model for criteria related to Visibility Period Actions.

actionType.description: The type of the action. Values can be "NOTIFICATION" or "WORKFLOW_TEMPLATE".

id.description: The unique ID of an action.

SchedulingShiftTemplateApplyReadWhereEqu.description: Parameters for Shift templates Apply Read for equivalent request.

SchedulingShiftTemplateMultiDeleteWhereR.description: Parameters for Shift templates Multi Delete request by references.

SchedulingShiftTemplateMultiReadWhereEmp.description: Parameters for Shift templates Multi Read for employee request.

SchedulingShiftTemplateMultiReadWhereRef.description: Parameters for Shift templates Multi Read request by references.

staffingCount.description: The staffing count of the staffing matrix item.

SchedulingPatternElementForRest.description: The pattern element for a single head count in a workload pattern.

SchedulingPredictiveSchedulingEvaluateAd.description: The predictive scheduling evaluate add model.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of a predictive scheduling evaluate add action in ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME format (yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS).

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of a predictive scheduling evaluate add action in ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME format (yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS).

SchedulingPredictiveSchedulingEvaluateUp.description: The predictive scheduling evaluate update model.

shiftId.description: The shift ID of a predictive scheduling evaluate update action.

SchedulingLaborCategoryEntry.description: A key-value reference pair corresponding to a labor category entry.

SchedulingAvailabilitySegmentTemplate.description: Model describing the availability segment template.

endTime.description: The inclusive end date and time of the availability segment in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

id.description: The ID of the availability segment template.

startTime.description: The inclusive start date and time of the availability segment in ISO_LOCAL_DATE format (YYYY-MM-DD).

SchedulingScheduleTagSegmentTemplate.description: Model describing the schedule tag segment template.

id.description: The ID for the schedule tag segment template.

scheduleTagColor.description: The color for the schedule tag segment template.

SchedulingRuleParameterValueType.description: Model for Schedule Rule Parameter Value Type.

id.description: The ID of a schedule rule parameter value type.

localizedName.description: The localized name of a schedule rule parameter value type.

name.description: The name of a schedule rule parameter value type.

timeType.description: A Boolean indicator for time type.

SchedulingPredictiveSchedulingEvaluateCh.description: The predictive scheduling evaluate change model.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of a predictive scheduling evaluate change in ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME format (yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS).

segments.description: The segments of a predictive scheduling evaluate change.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of a predictive scheduling evaluate change in ISO_LOCAL_DATE_TIME format (yyyy-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS).

SchedulingPredictiveSchedulingEvaluateSe.description: The predictive scheduling evaluate segment model.

order.description: The order of a predictive scheduling evaluate segment.
